html.p: If [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] is a vector space with an inner product, and [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] is a subspace of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] with an orthogonal basis [mathjaxinline]\{ u_1; u_2; \ldots u_ k\}[/mathjaxinline], then the orthogonal projection of a vector [mathjaxinline]v\in V[/mathjaxinline] onto [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] is given by the formula

tr.td: [mathjax]\mathrm{Proj}_ W(v) = \sum _{i=1}^ k \frac{\langle v, u_ i \rangle }{\langle u_ i, u_ i \rangle } u_ i.[/mathjax]

html.p: It is the unique vector [mathjaxinline]\hat{v} \in W[/mathjaxinline] which has the property that [mathjaxinline]v-\hat{v}[/mathjaxinline] is orthogonal to all [mathjaxinline]w\in W[/mathjaxinline]. Additionally, [mathjaxinline]\mathrm{Proj}_ W(v)[/mathjaxinline] is the closest vector in [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] to [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline].
